dataIdInfo.idPurp: The GRID3 NGA - Health Facilities v2.0 dataset is a non-exhaustive, non-validated geographic representation of health facility points in Nigeria. The dataset incorporates recent updates from both the Nigeria Health Facility Registry (HFR) and GRID3. This dataset is considered operational.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This current version supersedes the GRID3 NGA - Health Facilities dataset; the following changes were made:

  • Change of data schema

  • Update of data inputs to incorporate records from the Nigeria Health Facility Registry (HFR, 2024).

  • Schema and data attributes’ standardization based on national guidelines (NHFR, 2024; NPHCDA, n.d.).

(1. Federal Ministry of Health, 2024. NIGERIA Health Facility Registry (HFR), unpublished.; 2. National Primary Health Care Development Agency (NPHCDA), n.d. “Minimum Standards for Primary Health Care in Nigeria”. NPHCDA, downloaded from https://nesgroup.org/download_policy_drafts/Minimum%20Standards%20for%20Primary%20Health%20Care%20in%20Nigeria_1661780983.pdf in October 2024.)

Dataset citation

Center for Integrated Earth System Information (CIESIN), Columbia University 2024. GRID3 NGA - Health Facilities v2.0. New York: GRID3. https://doi.org/10.7916/kv1n-0743. Accessed [DAY MONTH YEAR].

Contacts and data queries

The authors of this dataset appreciate feedback regarding the data, including suggestions, discovery of errors, difficulties in using the data, and format preferences. For dataset-related questions, please send an email to: info@ciesin.columbia.edu

Known Data Limitations and Disclaimer

The spatial accuracy and overall quality of this dataset is dependent on both the quality of the input data used as well as on the correctness of the edits made throughout data processing. Temporal mismatches exist among the input data and other reference data (i.e. satellite imagery, settlement polygons, other health facility data used as reference). This may lead to health facilities not being identified or the erroneous inclusion of abandoned health facilities. Likewise, spelling mistakes and/or mismatches may have occurred due to colloquial variations on how data points are referred to across data sources. This dataset has not been fully validated by government officials or in-country stakeholders.
